## Introduction

The rise of **Artificial Intelligence (AI)** and **Machine Learning (ML)** continues to reshape job markets across industries worldwide. This analysis examines the evolving landscape of hiring trends, which skills are now more in-demand  and how job descriptions for roles in business analytics, data science, and machine learning have changed, with a particular focus on the requirements for AI and ML expertise. It explores how the integration of advanced analytics is driving changes in hiring practices, identifies the industries that are most aggressively recruiting data scientists, and evaluates the career prospects for business analytics professionals in this rapidly transforming technological environment.

## Literature Review
Research indicates that **AI and machine learning are reshaping labor markets** by increasing skill demands, raising entry barriers, and emphasizing data science and technical expertise for business competitiveness. AI is transforming labor market skill demands. It emphasizes the increasing importance of digital literacy and cognitive adaptability [@green2024artificial]. Machine learning raises job entry barriers by increasing experience and technical skill expectations [@liu2024does].
